summary: A highly-qualified professional with vast multidisciplinary background in artificial intelligence and software engineering. Practical experience of developing commercial products in such fields as natural language processing, computer vision, recommendation systems, autonomous driving and embedded devices. PhD degree in Robotics and strong academic background including research and lecturing. Currently, focusing on solving the challenges in automated content moderation as well as representation and transfer learning for tabular data.

awards: [{'title': 'Postdoc Mobility Travel Grant', 'description': 'I was one of about 30 young scientists selected by TUM among over 300 candidates from all over the world who were invited to the Research Opportunities Week (ROW) in Munich. During this week, the participants have the opportunity to visit different research facilities at TUM, to meet Professors of their disciplines and to create a scientific network. This Grant funds the stay in full. After the ROW, participants get the exclusive chance to apply for the TUM University Foundation Fellowship and to spend a year as a postdoc at TUM. Detailed information is here http://www.tum.de/en/research/postdocs/research-opportunities-week.', 'issuer': 'Technical University of Munich (TUM)', 'date': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}}]

N.E. Baumana', 'description': 'Job responsibilities:
• Giving lectures in robot kinematics, dynamics and control to the students of the Robotics and Mechatronics Department.
• Supervising students in their diploma and course work.

Research work:
• Investigation of a kinematic calibration approach applied to robot manipulators which is based on the developed kinematic model representation. The approach was presented on the XII Russian National Conference on Control Problems.
• Improvement of the methods developed in the PhD thesis in order to apply them to parallel computations in control and simulation of rigid multibody systems. The main concepts as well as the examples of computational architecture have been presented on the international conferences.

Projects together with students:
• Improvement of the positioning accuracy of industrial robots using the visual feedback of a gripper.
• Mathematical model and control system of a service mobile robot with a spherical wheel (ballbot).
• Mathematical model and stabilization system of a quadcopter.', 'title': 'Assistant Professor', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'ENM Technology', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2011}, 'end': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Москва, Россия', 'date': {'start': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2011}, 'end': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}}, 'company': 'ENM Technology', 'description': 'Development of a new distributed industrial automation platform, whose modules are based on bare metal STM32 ARM microcontrollers (MCUs). Each module has a CAN bus interface for data exchange with other modules, a USB interface for configuration and some module-specific hardware. Software is built around a small multitasking real-time kernel, and includes abstract layer for various MCU peripherals, middleware (e.g. BSD sockets, USB CDC) and application.
